title: Whittingham: U-M title quest my 'final challenge'
content: Kyle Whittingham said it was a "no-brainer" to take the Michigan job, and he sees a "legitimate" opportunity to win a national title as his "final challenge" as a coach.

title: Standout RB Hawkins plans to leave North Texas
content: North Texas running back Caleb Hawkins, a true freshman who leads the FBS with 29 touchdowns, said Sunday he plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal.

title: Steelers TE Washington suffers forearm injury
content: Steelers tight end Darnell Washington will not return to Sunday's game against the Browns after sustaining a forearm injury in the first half.

title: Illness has Bears WR Moore questionable to play
content: The Bears added wide receivers DJ Moore and Olamide Zaccheaus to the injury report Sunday morning with an illness and designated both as questionable to play against the 49ers.

title: Slumping Lakers hold meeting, eye 'recalibration'
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick said Saturday was a day of "recalibration and reconnection" for slumping Los Angeles, which has lost three straight and six of 10.

title: Tkachuk back at Panthers practice after surgery
content: Matthew Tkachuk is back on the ice with the Panthers, appearing at practice on Sunday for the first time this season.

title: Pulisic nets in Milan win, on pace for best campaign
content: Christian Pulisic is on pace for the best season of his career -- in a season that will conclude with a home World Cup played in the United States.

title: Kyrgios bests Sabalenka in 'Battle of the Sexes'
content: Nick Kyrgios bested top-ranked women's player Aryna Sabalenka in straight sets to win a lighthearted "Battle of the Sexes" exhibition match in Dubai.

title: üëÄ How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Week 17 inactives: Trouble at TE? What's the word on Kincaid, Knox, Kittle?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 17, featuring Stefon Diggs
content: Before the NFL's Week 17 slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eye Forest's England U21 star McAtee
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca wants to be reunited with former Manchester City midfielder James McAtee. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'Focus on ending war': Zelenskyy meets Trump ahead of peace talks - top developments
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy briefed UK PM Starmer on frontline updates and preparations for his meeting with US President Trump. Trump also spoke with Russian President Putin ahead of the talks, with both sides reportedly agreeing a ceasefire could prolong the conflict. EU leaders reaffirmed support for Ukraine, as Zelenskyy prepares to present his peace proposal.

title: US: 1 dead as two helicopters collide mid-air; video shows thick smoke
content: Two helicopters collided mid-air and crashed in Hammonton, New Jersey, with one aircraft fully engulfed in flames. Emergency crews are on scene, actively extricating at least one patient from the wreckage. The investigation is ongoing, and the public is urged to avoid the area.

title: Suriname: Man fatally stabs nine people including 5 kids; all dead
content: A man fatally stabbed nine people, including five children, in Paramaribo, Suriname, overnight. Police responded by shooting the suspect, who sustained leg wounds and was taken into custody. Two others, a child and an adult, were seriously injured and hospitalized.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared a key lesson learned from the Google Glass failure, advising entrepreneurs to fully develop their ideas before public stunts. He admitted to rushing commercialization and aiming for a "Steve Jobs moment" prematurely.

title: Ladkah: On the roof of the world, feral dogs hunt down Ladakh‚Äôs rare species
content: Ladakh's pristine cold desert faces a crisis as feral dogs, numbering nearly 45,000, threaten endangered wildlife like snow leopards and Pallas's cats.  Human activities, including increased tourism and unmanaged waste, have fueled their rapid multiplication.  Conservationists warn these canines, now outnumbering native predators, pose a significant ecological threat and have even attacked humans.

title: '80 drones in 36 hrs': Pak's big admission on Op Sindoor; confirms damage to Nur Khan base
content: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar has confirmed India's precision strikes on the Nur Khan Air Base in May, acknowledging damage and injuries. This rare admission follows similar statements by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, detailing the impact of Indian drone incursions and missile attacks after Operation Sindoor. Satellite imagery corroborates the damage to multiple air bases.

title: 'Start getting active': Trump's message to UN; boasts role in Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump criticized the United Nations as ineffective, particularly regarding the Russia-Ukraine conflict. He claimed the US acted as the "REAL United Nations" by facilitating a ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia, highlighting the swift resolution achieved through American involvement.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: Inhumane act: Puppies burned to death in West Bengal for whimpering in cold; animal lovers protest
content: Four men allegedly burned five puppies to death in Howrah after being annoyed by their cries in the cold. The mother dog was also injured. Animal lovers have protested, demanding swift punishment for the perpetrators, who are currently at large as police investigate.

title: Joel Embiid injury update: Will 76ers star play vs Thunder tonight?
content: Philadelphia 76ers' star Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game against the Oklahoma City Thunder due to a right ankle sprain and ongoing right knee management. This absence, confirmed early, forces the team to adjust its rotation and rely more on Tyrese Maxey and Paul George for offense and defense against a strong Thunder squad.

title: ‚ÄòAI agents are becoming a problem‚Äô: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: Who is Charli D‚ÄôAmelio? TikTok star age revealed amid FaZe Banks grooming claims
content: Online claims have surfaced against FaZe Banks involving Charli D'Amelio. Allegations suggest a relationship occurred before Charli turned 18. FaZe Banks has strongly denied these accusations, stating he met Charli in April 2024. He plans legal action against those making the claims. Charli D'Amelio was born on May 1, 2004, making her 21 years old. The situation is developing.

title: 'Oye Chinese': Racial taunt triggers fatal stabbing; main accused likely fled to Nepal
content: A student from Tripura, Anjel Chakma, died after being stabbed in Dehradun following racial slurs and an assault by a group of men. He had reportedly objected to being called "Chinki" and "Chinese." His younger brother also sustained injuries in the violent confrontation.

title: Fresh unease in Cong? Digvijaya Singh‚Äôs RSS praise sparks flutter; 'Godse' barb follows
content: Senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh's praise for the RSS's organizational strength sparked internal debate within the party. While Singh admired the RSS's ability to elevate grassroots workers, several Congress leaders dismissed the comparison, emphasizing their party's Gandhian roots and opposing the RSS ideology.

title: Jake Paul & Jutta Leerdam net worth 2025: Olympics, boxing, business
content: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: Brittany Mahomes looks past Chiefs struggles; praises Patrick‚Äôs off-field impact
content: Patrick Mahomes' 15 and the Mahomies Foundation is making a significant community impact, with partner Youth Volunteer Corps reporting over 92,000 volunteer hours and $3.2 million in community benefit. Brittany Mahomes actively supports these efforts, highlighting the foundation's growing influence beyond football.  The foundation's initiatives, like Read for 15 and Volunteer for 15, foster positive development in young people.

title: 'I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season': Travis Kelce
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: Year ender 2025: How women became the X-factor of the year
content: In 2025, women emerged as the decisive force, shaping outcomes across various spheres. From Operation Sindoor's symbolic and active response to terror, to women voters determining Bihar's fate, their influence was undeniable. New women leaders reshaped global politics, athletes dominated sports, and Roshni Nadar redefined economic power, marking a year of profound change.

title: Hadi murder: Police rejects B'desh claims of suspects entering India; calls allegations 'misleading'
content: Meghalaya security agencies have refuted claims by Bangladesh Police that killers of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi entered India. Officials stated there is no evidence of any individual crossing the border from the Haluaghat sector into Meghalaya, with the BSF maintaining high alert and constant surveillance.

title: 'Third party intended to marry': Ex-Pak cricketer's wife drops bombshell on divorce
content: ‚ÄúI am writing this from a place of deep pain. My home has been broken, and my children have been left without their father. I am a mother of three, including a five month old infant who has yet to be held by his father. This is not a story I wished to share, but silence should never be mistaken for weakness," she wrote.

title: 'RSS is like al-Qaida': Congress MP says Sangh 'breeds hate'; BJP hits out
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore drew controversy by comparing the RSS to al-Qaeda, stating the organisation "breeds hatred and propagates hatred." This remark followed senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh's praise for the RSS's organisational strength. An RSS member, Indresh Kumar, criticised Tagore's comment as a reflection of the Congress leadership's "intellectual and mental bankruptcy."

title: 'Horrific': US slams mob violence on Hindu worker in Bangladesh; demands action
content: The US State Department has strongly condemned the "horrific" mob killing of Hindu garment worker Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh, demanding an unequivocal stand against religious hatred.  This statement follows growing concerns over attacks on minority communities. US lawmakers have also voiced outrage, urging condemnation of such bigotry. The incident highlights the precarious situation for religious minorities amid political shifts.

title: Key revelations in Udaipur IT manager gang-rape case; CEO, executive head arrested
content: Udaipur police have arrested an IT company CEO, Jayesh Sisodia, and two others for allegedly gang-raping a female manager in a moving car after a birthday party. The survivor claims she was drugged and assaulted, with dashcam footage reportedly capturing the incident. The accused are in police custody.

title: In search of Bharatiya 'porichoy': Will Matuas rewrite 'poriborton' in Bengal polls?
content: Why the Matua-Namasudra community views politics the way it does becomes clearer when one looks beyond electoral arithmetic, beyond BJP versus Trinamool Congress (TMC), and even before the creation of Bangladesh. The Matua movement, by the early twentieth century, had become as much a social force as a religious one.

title: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt fear celebrities‚Äô: Dhruv Rathee on Janhvi Kapoor thumbnail row
content: A YouTube thumbnail featuring a before-and-after image of Janhvi Kapoor has snowballed into a major social media controversy. The image was used by Dhruv Rathee in his video discussing ‚Äúfake beauty‚Äù and cosmetic procedures, prompting sharp reactions online. Matters escalated when several users alleged that the video was a reaction to Janhvi‚Äôs recent post supporting Bangladeshi Hindus, with timing and visuals fuelling speculation.

title: 'He told me 15 days before': How Rohit helped set up Jaiswal's Test debut
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's India debut was profoundly shaped by captain Rohit Sharma's early assurance and clear communication. Sharma informed Jaiswal of his selection fifteen days prior, fostering confidence. This trust allowed Jaiswal to debut with a remarkable 171, showcasing maturity. He credits Sharma as an elder brother figure, inspiring him and instilling the importance of upholding Indian cricket's values.

title: Assam: Minor attempts suicide after videos of sexual assault leaked; threatened with acid attack
content: A 17-year-old Assam schoolgirl attempted suicide after a 19-year-old youth allegedly leaked explicit videos of her online. The youth had subjected her to sexual torture and threatened her with acid attacks, using the secretly filmed videos to blackmail her into compliance.

title: Former Pakistan cricketer announces divorce from wife Sannia
content: Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim has confirmed his divorce from wife Sannia Ashfaq after six years of marriage, citing unresolved issues and mutual consent. Sannia also confirmed the separation, attributing it to a third-party involvement that ended their struggling union. The couple has three children.

title: Twist in court: 2nd husband testifies for 1st; woman loses 17-year old domestic violence case
content: A 17-year-old domestic violence case took an unexpected turn when a woman's current husband testified, confirming her second marriage. This revelation led a Borivli court to rule she was no longer entitled to maintenance from her ex-husband, effectively ending her claim for protection and monetary relief initiated in 2009.

title: The Boogeyman & Melissa George net worth 2025: WWE legacy and earnings
content: WWE icon The Boogeyman, Marty Wright, and actress Melissa George have a combined net worth of approximately $7 million as of 2025. George's acting career contributes the larger share, with both having diversified income streams from their respective entertainment fields. Their success reflects legacy, audience loyalty, and decades of creative labor.

title: NFL rules on Dak Prescott‚Äôs role in Chargers sideline altercation
content: The NFL has decided not to punish Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott for his involvement in an on-field altercation. Following a dangerous hit on a teammate, Prescott exchanged words with the opposing player but was ultimately deemed to have acted emotionally but restrained.

title: West Bengal: Humayun Kabir's son 'assualts' cop in Murshidabad; detained
content: Golam Nabi Azad, son of Janata Unnayan Party chief Humayun Kabir, was arrested in Murshidabad for allegedly assaulting a police officer at his family residence. The officer filed a complaint after Azad reportedly objected to his presence and then assaulted him. Kabir claims the arrest is politically motivated by the TMC.

title: Bengaluru: Man gets life term for murdering wife; strangled her when sleeping pills didn‚Äôt work
content: A husband was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering his wife after she discovered a tattoo of another woman on his arm. He drugged her with sleeping pills mixed in beer, and when she survived, he strangled her. Circumstantial evidence, including CCTV footage and witness testimonies, led to his conviction.

title: Battle of the Sexes: How Sabalenka‚ÄìKyrgios match strips politics from a historic feminist moment
content: Tennis legend Billie Jean King distinguishes the upcoming "Battle of the Sexes" exhibition between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios from her historic 1973 match. King emphasizes her original contest was pivotal for social change and women's rights, a stark contrast to the current event, which she deems apolitical and primarily for entertainment and profit, questioning its benefit to women's tennis.

title: 'I‚Äôm really lucky': Chloe Kim praises Myles Garrett ahead of Olympic return
content: Chloe Kim shared heartfelt praise for Myles Garrett, saying she is inspired by his work ethic, kindness, and steady support. As she prepares for another Olympic season, the two-time gold medalist explained that their connection is built on respect, not fame. Kim said Garrett‚Äôs character and encouragement help her navigate pressure while staying grounded and focused.

title: 'Cong all united': Digvijaya after RSS remark; condemns BJP's 'attempts to sow discord'
content: Digvijaya Singh asserted Congress unity amidst a BJP controversy over his praise for the RSS's organizational strength. He accused the BJP of trying to divide the Nehru-Gandhi family, emphasizing the party's solidarity. Singh clarified his stance, stating his opposition to the RSS and PM Modi while supporting a strong organizational framework.

title: 'It was awful stuff': Former cricket legend tears into modern batting after Boxing Day Test
content: Geoffrey Boycott attributed England's Boxing Day Test victory to superior fundamentals rather than luck, criticizing modern batting development. He argued that white-ball dominance and flat pitches hinder batsmen's ability to handle moving balls on seaming surfaces, a problem exacerbated by reduced County cricket. Boycott also highlighted Australia's ordinary batting, calling their dismissals "shockers" and the overall display "awful stuff."

title: How B'luru techie became Andhra‚Äôs ‚Äòlady don‚Äô; arrested for supplying 'Sheelavathi strain'
content: Nathavaram police have arrested eight individuals, including a Bengaluru software engineer, for smuggling high-quality Sheelavathi strain cannabis from Narsipatnam to Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka. The operation, led by 'lady don' Gade Renuka, involved procuring ganja from Odisha and distributing it, marking a potential first for smuggling to Sri Lanka via the Andhra-Odisha border.

title: 'Most guests were Hindus': UP woman on Bajrang Dal's b'day disruption over 'love jihad'
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, falsely accusing two Muslim guests of "love jihad" despite most attendees being Hindu. Police booked the Muslim guests and a cafe staffer for breach of peace, though an inquiry found no wrongdoing by the students. The victim stated the "love jihad" claim was unfounded.

title: Quote of the day by Geoffrey Chaucer: 'Women naturally desire the same six things...'
content: Geoffrey Chaucer, often called the Father of English Literature, rose from a merchant's son to a respected figure through diverse careers. His works, like "The Canterbury Tales," used "everyday English" to explore societal hypocrisies and human desires, influencing literature for centuries. Chaucer's genius lay in observing and portraying life without judgment.

title: Hounded after wife's suicide, Bengaluru man drives 1000 km to kill self
content: In a heart-wrenching incident, Suraj Shivanna from Bengaluru succumbed to despair and ended his life in a Nagpur hotel, mere days after his wife's unfortunate passing. Grappling with accusations of dowry harassment and the impending strain from his in-laws, Suraj and his relatives were attempting to escape when the incident occurred.

title: 2.8 Crore Names Removed From UP's Draft Voter Rolls After SIR
content: The draft electoral roll in Uttar Pradesh, which will be published on December 31, is likely to have the names of about 12.55 crore voters, with almost 2.89 crore names deleted from the pre-SIR voter list.

title: Rolls-Royce Plans Making India Its 3rd "Home Market," Eyes Jet Engine
content: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce said it is looking at making India its third "home market" outside of the UK in line with a plan to unlock the full potential of opportunities across an array of domains

title: Amid Revanth Reddy-KCR Face-Off, Winter Session In Telangana From Tomorrow
content: The Telangana Legislative Assembly's winter session, set to begin on Monday, is expected to be one of the most significant and volatile since the Congress government took office.

title: Trump's "Productive Call" With Putin Ahead Of Zelensky Meeting
content: US President Donald Trump said he had a productive telephone call with his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, on Sunday.

title: 'Nothing To Fear With Army On Our Side': J&K Villagers On Winter Ops
content: As the snow-bound mountains of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar and Doda transform into a battleground, the Indian Army has launched a decisive winter campaign to eradicate terrorism in the region.

title: A Trump Phone Call To Putin Before And After Zelensky Meeting
content: Russian leader Vladimir Putin and US counterpart Donald Trump had a "friendly" phone call Sunday before Trump's meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Florida, and will talk again after it concludes, the Kremlin said.

title: Archaeologists Discover Kashmir's Buddhist Past, "Proud Moment," Says PM
content: A recent archaeological discovery in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district has brought Kashmir's Buddhist past into the spotlight. Prime Minister Narender Modi has termed the discovery a proud moment.

title: Telangana Couple's Divorce After 17 Years Of Separation, Rs 50 Lakh Alimony
content: Ending a nearly two-decade-long legal battle, the Telangana High Court has upheld a divorce decree in a long-fractured marriage, ordering the husband to pay a lump sum of Rs 50 lakh as permanent alimony and maintenance.

title: Rahul Gandhi's "Mischief" Banter With Digvijay Singh Day After 'RSS-BJP' Post
content: Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Digvijaya Singh, who had advised the Congress to learn from the RSS-BJP relationship, met Rahul Gandhi face-to-face today at the party headquarters, Indira Bhavan, on the occasion of Congress Foundation Day.

title: Amid Poor Air Quality In Delhi, 'Orange' Alert Issued For Dense Fog On Monday
content: The national capital recorded air quality in the "very poor" category on Sunday with an overall Air Quality Index reading of 390, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: Man Duped Of Rs 12 Crore Over Fake Luxury Flat At Gurugram's DLF Camellias
content: Five people have been arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly duping a man of Rs 12 crore by selling a non-existent luxury property at DLF Camellias in Gurugram, officials said on Sunday.

title: Zelensky To Pitch Territorial Concessions To Trump In Today's Meet
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky will push a new peace plan for Ukraine when he sits down with Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday, bolstered by the backing of European leaders but with his capital Kyiv still reeling from a massive Russian bombardment.

title: Manipur's 'Ring Road', Built Without Permission And Named After Militants, NGT Orders To Stop Work
content: A 'ring road' paved allegedly without the state government's approval and passing through forests in six districts has been found in Manipur.

title: Rahul Gandhi Asked Why They "Lose Every Time": Amit Shah's Jibe
content: The spirit of public service, proper work culture and the mantra of development is not something understood by the Opposition, and this is why they lose every time, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said at a programme in Gujarat today.

title: "Israeli-American Plan": Hezbollah Chief Naim Qassem Rejects Calls To Disarm
content: Hezbollah leader Naim Qassem on Sunday said moves to disarm the group in Lebanon are an "Israeli-American plan", accusing Israel of failing to abide by a ceasefire agreement sealed last year.

title: Supreme Court To Hear CBI's Plea Against Kuldeep Sengar's Bail In Unnao Rape Case Tomorrow
content: A 3-judge Bench of the Supreme Court will hear the Central Bureau of Investigation's (CBI) plea against the Delhi High Court order that suspended the life sentence and granted bail to expelled Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar

title: 5 Children Among 9 Stabbed To Death In Suriname, Suspect Shot, Arrested
content: A man stabbed to death nine people, including five children, overnight in Suriname's capital Paramaribo, police said Sunday, adding the suspect was wounded and arrested.

title: President Droupadi Murmu Undertakes Submarine Sortie At Karnataka Naval Base
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday undertook an over two-hour sortie onboard the indigenously-built submarine INS Vaghsheer on the Western seaboard, signalling India's focus on boosting undersea warfare capabilities.

title: "Is KC Venugopal Super Chief Minister?" BJP vs Congress Over Bengaluru Demolition
content: A controversy has erupted over the demolition of unauthorised constructions in Bengaluru, with the BJP accusing the Congress's central leadership of superseding the state's elected government over an issue that comes under the state administration.

title: 'Police Refused To File Case': Father Of Tripura Man Killed In Racial Attack
content: The father of Anjel Chakma, a student from Tripura who died here in Dehradun, said his son was "brutally attacked" with knives and blunt objects when he tried to defend his brother, who faced racial slurs and was called "Chinese" by the attackers.

title: Draft voters‚Äô list out, BLOs still busy with mapping exercise
content: A total of 19.32 lakh people have been included in the ‚Äòunmapped‚Äô list in the State, of whom 2.1 lakh are in Ernakulam

title: IndiGo to begin flight services from Tamil Nadu to Navi Mumbai airport from December 29
content: An aviation source said the 186-seat all-economy class Airbus A320 services will be linked to the first phase of the Navi Mumbai airport‚Äôs operational hours, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Watch: Pakistan President Zardari reveals he was advised to ‚Äòhide in a bunker‚Äô during Operation Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has revealed that he was advised to hide in a bunker when India launched Operation Sindoor in May. Speaking at an event marking the 18th death anniversary of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, Zardari recalled the tense moments during the India-Pakistan military escalation and praised Army chief Asim Munir‚Äôs response.

title: Punch marked gold coins from Vijayanagara-era unearthed near Jolarpet
content: Revenue officials also apprised the discovery of coins to Collector¬†K.¬†Siva Soundaravalli, who is the custodian of the district treasury as per the Indian Treasure Trove Act, 1878

title: H-1B visa reflects race, class dynamics of modern diaspora, says former JNU professor
content: R. K. Jain says migration shaped by political and cultural factors, and not economics alone, remains central to understanding social inequality

title: Winter bird count conducted in Vellore and nearby districts
content: Forest officials said most of the habitats in these districts are home for local birds that migrate within specified areas round the year

title: What election rules miss about shadow campaigns in India
content: An analysis of digital political advertisements during the Bihar Assembly election shows that third-party actors outspend official parties and candidates and achieve far greater visibility; this creates an accountability gap, allowing opaque funding and influence to persist beyond regulatory oversight

title: S. Krishnaswamy, master chronicler of subcontinental history
content: His magnum opus, the four-hour-long film traversing 5,000 years of subcontinental history, ‚ÄòIndus Valley to Indira Gandhi‚Äô, was released in December 1976.

title: Matua community one of the most affected groups in SIR process in West Bengal, says study
content: The community of Hindu refugees largely residing in North 24 Parganas and Nadia district have been apprehensive of the SIR since they lack legacy data

title: Red Fort blast victims yet to get govt. compensation
content: Kin of dead say despite submitting documents, they are yet to get any response from Delhi government; victims robbed of livelihood struggle, say authorities have asked them to wait

title: Uttar Pradesh SIR: Nearly 2.89 crore names deleted from draft voter list
content: Those excluded will have a chance to contest the deletion starting January 1, the State's chief electoral officer says

title: Acclaimed documentary filmmaker S. Krishnaswamy passes away
content: Dr. Krishnaswamy was the founder of Krishnaswamy Associates; he received the Padma Shri in 2009 and the Dr. V. Shantaram Lifetime Achievement Award in 2020

title: KWA‚Äôs 190-MLD water treatment plant awaits government approval
content: ‚ÄòThe proposal, updated after a revision in the cost estimate, was put on hold following the announcement of the local body elections but is expected to move forward in the coming weeks‚Äô

title: After public uproar, right-wing attackers booked for assaulting Muslim youth in birthday party in Bareilly
content: Videos of the incident went viral in which a group of activists are seen storming the cafe, and police earlier acted against the victim, two Muslim youths and the cafe staff by issuing challan for disturbing peace

title: DMK¬†stoutly opposes Congress leaders‚Äô demand for a share in power in¬†Tamil Nadu
content: Such an arrangement (a coalition government) will not work in Tamil Nadu,¬†a highly placed source in the¬†DMK¬†says, indicating that the party leadership will remain firm in its decision

title: Indian officials deny Bangladesh police‚Äôs allegations about Hadi‚Äôs killers fleeing to Meghalaya
content: The Indian denial came soon after Dhaka police said that two suspects in the December 12 shooting of Mr. Hadi ‚Äî Faisal Karim Masud and Alamgir Sheikh had crossed into Meghalaya

title: DGCA warns lack of preparedness posing risk to aviation safety
content: Airline operators told to enforce¬†¬†safety regulations effectively to avoid inconvenience to passengers

title: Congress invites applications for GBA elections
content: The applications will cost ‚Çπ50,000 for general category candidates and ‚Çπ25,000 for candidates from SC/ST communities

title: Pappanji to be set ablaze at two venues in Fort Kochi this New Year
content: The effigy put up by the Cochin Carnival Committee will be burnt at Parade Ground, while Gala De Fort Kochi, a local charity club, has received permission to burn the effigy it erected at Veli Ground

title: Vizianagaram real estate sees boom in 2025
content: Vizianagaram‚Äôs promixity to Visakhapatnam, where new projects of Google, Infosys and Cognizant among others are coming up, is a driver of the boom

title: Vellore Corporation to complete pipeline work on Chennai - Bengaluru Highway
content: Corporation officials said that as the service lane and Green Circle witnesses huge traffic flow, the civic body is allowed to undertake pipeline work between 11 p.m and 3 a.m

title: Tirupati police open 187 POCSO sheets, step up monitoring of accused
content: Nine convictions recorded in child sexual offence cases in 2025 as cybercrime numbers dip but financial losses rise

title: Chittur-Thattamangalam municipality abolishes ‚Äòrespected,‚Äô ‚Äòhonourable‚Äô honorifics
content: Chittur-Thattamangalam has become the first local body in the country to scrap the honorific title ‚Äòrespected‚Äô

title: All eyes on Revanth‚Äôs aggression and KCR‚Äôs presence as Telangana Assembly winter session begins on Monday
content: The acrimonious verbal exchanges between the Congress and the BRS over the past week are expected to spill over into the House, raising concerns over decorum

title: Dhaka rejects India‚Äôs remarks over hostilities against minorities in Bangladesh
content: Ministry of External Affairs on Friday (December 26) said the "unremitting hostilities" against minorities in Bangladesh are a matter of "grave concern"

title: Survey reveals the dark side of loan recovery in India
content: Despite RBI guidelines and court rulings, borrowers say banks and recovery agents routinely resort to threats, intimidation and public shaming

title: Gautam Adani calls Sharad Pawar mentor
content: Signs MoU with Vidya Pratishthan, the Baramati-based educational trust associated with the Pawar family, to support research and development, placements and related initiatives at the AI centre

title: Stress laid on fostering artistic and cultural awareness among students
content: Sargotsavam 2025, State-level arts festival of students from model residential schools under Scheduled Tribes Development department, begins in Kannur

title: Vijayawada‚Äôs real estate sees moderate progress in 2025
content: Despite government‚Äôs efforts to streamline the approval process, such as amendments to the Building Rules 2017, introducing the Self-Certification Scheme 2025, and abolishing the NALA Act, business has been slow, says A.P. CREDAI secretary

title: NITK uses machine learning to predict landslides in Western Ghats
content: The system combines rainfall analysis, real-time monitoring of soil¬†behaviour¬†and surface movement, and machine learning to provide reliable landslide warnings

title: Sabarmati flood victims get land rights after five decades
content: Ownership papers handed over to families displaced in 1973 as Gujarat launches major urban infrastructure projects

title: WINGS Thiruvananthapuram bird count records 188 species
content: 85 species, the highest among the 10 regions surveyed, was spotted at Kottoor forests. Arippa forest also  emerged as a species-rich site, yielding 83 species

title: Kerala politics spills over to Karnataka after eviction drive in Bengaluru
content: The statements of Kerala CM and AICC general secretary after an eviction drive in Bengaluru are seen as part of a narrative building exercise ahead of Assembly elections in Kerala expected early next year

title: Scouts and Guides helping shape children‚Äôs personality, says Speaker
content: State-level Scouts and Guides Jamborette launched at Phoenix Public School in Honaga village of Belagavi district

title: At Indian History Congress, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan  calls for resisting political distortion of history
content: Pinarayi Vijayan urges historians to defend evidence-based scholarship amidst growing attempts to rewrite history for ideological purposes, highlighting the systematic removal of key historical themes and figures from educational syllabi.

title: Congress seeks disqualification of Agali panchayat president
content: Congress member N.K. Manju had switched sides and became president of the Agali grama panchayat with the support of the LDF

title: CPI(M) to hold protest assemblies against new MGNREGS regulations
content: The scheme, which was originally fully funded by Centre, has undergone a significant shift to a 60:40 cost-sharing ratio between the Centre and the State

title: ‚ÄòRam Rajya‚Äô is the benchmark for good governance, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Lord Rama‚Äôs values and ideals are timeless lessons, and may they continue to guide and inspire us always, says the Chief Minister after offering special prayers at the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya

title: Education only path to development, says  Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Union Finance Minister inaugurates ‚Çπ18-lakh worth facilities at the Zilla Parishad High School at Pedamainavanilanka village in West Godavari, besides opening an AI skills hub provided by Cyient Limited in the village

title: CPI(M) alleges Congress-BJP nexus behind power shifts in Mattathur
content: CPI(M) district secretary says mass defection is a pre-meditated and well-planned move carried out with the knowledge of the Congress leadership. This incident is merely is a new version of what was earlier seen in¬†Vadakara¬†and¬†Beypore

content: The State Congress chief also asserted that the Congress will not forge any understanding with AIUDF, terming it a "communal" party

title: Implement internal committees under POSH Act in party offices across A.P., says CPI(M)
content: State party secretary welcomes the Women‚Äôs Commission‚Äôs efforts to amend and strengthen the Act, stresses need to prevent sexual harassment at workplaces, especially in political environments
